raw.title: [BIP-844] Grant ProtocolFeeController v2 Permissions to the Maxis Omni Multi-sig
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/2116 

## Summary
Grant permissions to the Maxis Omni-Multisig for the newly established Fee Controller V2 on all relevant chains
Allows the Maxis to set global swap and yield fees as well as per pool fee settings
Finalizes the Fee Controller Migration as per BIP-804

## Motivation
This proposal aims to grant the same permissions for the fee controller v2 as it was provided for fee controller v1 as per BIP-766. Note that Optimism was already deployed with the new fee controller in place where these permissions were already set. This can be verified by the BIP-814 payload artifacts.

Following Roles shall be granted on Mainnet, Arbitrum, Base, Gnosis and Avalanche:
* `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
* `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
* `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
* `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
* `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFees`
* `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFeesForToken`


## Technical Specification
The respective DAO multi-sig on each chain will call the AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint and grant following roles:
Mainnet:


```
+-----------------------+---------------------+--------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----+----------+
| function              | caller_name         | caller_address                             | fx_paths                                                                                                           | action_ids                                                         | bip | tx_index |
+-----------------------+---------------------+--------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----+----------+
| Authorizer/grantRoles | multisigs/maxi_omni | 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e | 20250214-v3-protocol-fee-controller-v2/ProtocolFeeController/setProtocolYieldFeePercentage(address,uint256)        | 0x6f9cec1ed72546777f4811dfb98cddfc8c5450bbafe05338a2b448042fa66ccb | N/A |    0     |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20250214-v3-protocol-fee-controller-v2/ProtocolFeeController/setProtocolSwapFeePercentage(address,uint256)         | 0x131cd3af8d8c0c7f25e7dd8769c67d3f02f751e3157cba459136bb2198d6f176 |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20250214-v3-protocol-fee-controller-v2/ProtocolFeeController/setGlobalProtocolYieldFeePercentage(uint256)          | 0xe438e214335740a99a96051b910141e28a247536c13657f84f4347ee29692ad4 |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20250214-v3-protocol-fee-controller-v2/ProtocolFeeController/setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage(uint256)           | 0xe514c4844d51db5976965d920621cc6b06d82b326c4aa9378c581f6f599127b3 |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20250214-v3-protocol-fee-controller-v2/ProtocolFeeController/withdrawProtocolFees(address,address)                 | 0xc41c3677f4ceeb34f5721789e9888c8ed8a6d28ee9f766a3a4485001e19148b1 |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20250214-v3-protocol-fee-controller-v2/ProtocolFeeController/withdrawProtocolFeesForToken(address,address,address) | 0x9fe8e7d354d4d4c9b828af97a9fb461b79747eb597d1d1919127b884ed03a3df |     |          |
+-----------------------+---------------------+--------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----+----------+
```

Arbitrum:

|                       |                     |                                            | 20250214-v3-protocol-fee-controller-v2/ProtocolFeeController/withdrawProtocolFees(address,address)                 | 0x97295b130cd0cac7ca34ac82289b4fa59f4f9fea3b2b2693f0e2d819cfb77118 |     |          |

cleaned.title: [BIP-803] Grant v3 ECLP disable Permissions to the Emergency DAO Multisigs
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-803] Grant v3 ECLP disable Permissions to the Emergency DAO Multisigs
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1834

### Motivation 
With the imminent launch of ECLPs on Balancer v3 on Mainnet, Arbitrum, Base and Gnosis chain, the emergency subDAO needs permissions to disable the factories in the case of a potential malfunction. It is therefore proposed that the emergency subDAO wallets on these chains are granted following roles by the authorizer:

#### Emergency DAO

`GyroECLPPoolFactory.disable`

| Network | Emergency Safe | Action ID |
| :---- | :---- | :---- |
| Mainnet | 0xA29F61256e948F3FB707b4b3B138C5cCb9EF9888 | 0x2d6f2043f87de4e7d3300eb8d3235d0a0015939b896057526473bb03cb53af84 |
| Arbitrum | 0xf404C5a0c02397f0908A3524fc5eb84e68Bbe60D | 0x95095549d7b771b285d8bc313117157a9c18db08596228d492e3fbc7c5dc751b |
| Base | 0x183C55A0dc7A7Da0f3581997e764D85Fd9E9f63a | 0x9a2847fdb9a96a453c9e5f3eda469d4f53b4e5616cbf9c20f6c820d30a30e40c |
| Gnosis | 0xd6110A7756080a4e3BCF4e7EBBCA8E8aDFBC9962 | 0x43951d61361ec89c52166ef54cf1f4d74ead1426b610bb3fd62aeea215ce8faa |

The action IDs can be verified by going to each chain and checking 20250124-v3-gyro-eclp, disable(), e.g. [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/33e050a42ddd7d17a7a2594c63348c3da42ea45e/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L1773)

## Technical Specifications

The DAO multisig on each network will interact with the Authorizer by calling `grantRole`, with `role` as the corresponding action ID mentioned in the table above and `account` as the Emergency subDAO safe.

Edit:
* added payload

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-778] Grant Maxis StableSurge Parameter Change Permissions
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1755

### Summary & Motivation

The [StableSurge](https://medium.com/balancer-protocol/balancers-stablesurge-hook-09d2eb20f219) hook has been deployed by the Balancer Labs team marking an exciting milestone for Balancer V3 as the first wave of hooks are hitting production. With these innovations come additional permissions related to the management of each hooks unique parameters. In the case of StableSurge the maxSurgeFeePercentage and surgeThresholdPercentage are key factors in determining how the hook will affect the pool performance and the liquidity providers. This proposal will act to grant the permissions to change both of these parameters to the Balancer Maxis on all currently deployed networks, Ethereum Mainnet, Gnosis, Arbitrum, and Base.

**Technical Specification:**

All deployments and action-ids can be verified in this StableSurgePoolFactory [pull request](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/pull/163/files#diff-17e7d1b01753c19be2eee514c14e09736db3af94d24025c7fd9876c73b6e7950).

**Ethereum**

On Mainnet the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Arbitrum**

On Arbitrum the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x261258d23af1013ceb3a0574a5f194e3d4d09a07c0b9014665519c3f1b37f792`, `0x5968f4b1f98171ccadc78df4f25cf8262b250f2f12a83c45b7311b4674d23e0a`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Base**

On Base the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0xe81edd4ccc5901443972e580b5d997ced38f33bd4f7e9bca8829dc5efcca6fed`, `0x4a7d099f7d634af69cf552b5b1c76ed8d44074051cbca5a59b842154288b96f1`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Gnosis**

On Gnosis the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-820] Grant Maxis StableSurge v2 Parameter Change Permissions
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload

https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1973

# Summary & Motivation

As Balancer labs has deployed a new and improved Stable surge hook contract with version 2, we are requesting to be allowed to control the same parameter set as with the v1 version as per [[BIP-778]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-778-grant-maxis-stablesurge-parameter-change-permissions/6346). This includes following parameters:

* setMaxSurgeFeePercentage
* setSurgeThresholdPercentage

on all networks Balancer v3 is currently deployed on and operated by the Balancer DAO (Mainnet, Arbitrum, Gnosis, and Base). These are key parameters in determining how the hook will affect the pool performance and the liquidity providers which the Maxis have been managing with v1 and intend to continue to do so with v2. Note that these permissions were already granted for Avalanche during the respective wire-up with [[BIP-813]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-813-grant-permissions-for-latest-v3-chain-deployment-avalanche/6465).

# Technical Specifications

All action-ids associated with StableSurge v2 can be verified with the associated [pull request](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/commit/5958f3ad13bedba44d0808665ff2e683f1db1a82).

## Ethereum

On Mainnet the Balancer DAO Multisig 0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f will interact with the Authorizer 0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6 calling grantRoles passing: [0xf38ecb07c88c5307ae7e207ff9f96c7707a6093a6abb7c5c61020119536cc236, 0x2b49aa01d0b0251c5fa59f092390a988da3dbdc3609dc3c4bc36a4491da73681] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e

## Arbitrum

On Arbitrum the Balancer DAO Multisig 0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0 will interact with the Authorizer 0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6 calling grantRoles passing: [0x7ed51e972f7682e8a513e8d697daf6179714308b17bffd3d972a34a8a86fe107, 0x3e5b3786c2433c83d82d4d118259a3cf5b7dd26b4f21c6c56115c2ce1cfa825b] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e

## Base

On Base the Balancer DAO Multisig 0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462 will interact with the Authorizer 0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a calling grantRoles passing: [0x01ef05374c39f0094ff2f8278f21a14a89ed025e8564c7a541d4f26ed9bd23fd, 0xccde3eb1bbf6269f3b1ff650d0e3bf089ad0a119c82f5e48db9761d64a346c77] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e

## Gnosis

On Gnosis the Balancer DAO Multisig 0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18 will interact with the Authorizer 0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6 calling grantRoles passing: [0x6648ca4015a562c4110635d0f2f8f402af08c32926b73b04307f778a4662ea47, 0xa9902a51b5285acf6244965666f9096d34561241355f4bd05e099f319fe8fde1] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal seeks to grant administrative permissions to the Maxis Omnisig and Emergency subDAO for operating and disabling ReCLAMM v2 pools, building on tested improvements from ReCLAMM v1. The timeline voting metrics strongly favor approval, and the similar past proposals with analogous permissions changes were successful and positively received. Forum discussion is neutral with no objections, reflecting a calm consensus. Market impacts are positive, indicating community confidence in the upgrade.
key_arguments_for: ReCLAMM v1 pools were tested and improved to develop ReCLAMM v2, justifying administrative permission grants to manage these improved pools.
Timeline analysis shows unanimous and stable support for the 'Yes, let's do it' option throughout the voting period.
Similar prior proposals granting admin permissions to related pools were approved with positive market and TVL responses.
Granting these permissions enables necessary operational control and emergency disable capabilities, enhancing protocol safety.
key_arguments_against: No explicit objections or negative sentiments found in forum discussion.
Potential risks of granting admin permissions could be concerns but were not raised or debated significantly.

evidence.quote: Forum discussion contains two neutral posts summarizing the proposal details without objection.
Timeline metrics indicate unanimous lead and stability for option 0 'Yes, let's do it' with 6 unique voters and consistent early voting.

evidence.reference: Adjacent similar proposals BIP-855 and BIP-854
evidence.quote: Similar proposals with administrative permission changes had positive market responses with price up ~8.87% and TVL up ~8.04%.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Ex-post tally not used per instructions; recommendation based on timeline and sentiment analysis.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline voting metrics show unanimous and stable support for approval, indicating strong community backing.
- Forum sentiment is neutral but no opposition, aligning with the recommended option.
- Similar historical proposals granting admin permissions were successful and positively impacted token price and TVL.
- Granting admin permissions is necessary for operational management and emergency controls of improved ReCLAMM v2 pools, supporting protocol security and upgrade.
- The recommendation mirrors forum opinion and voting sentiment, promoting long-term protocol health.
